text: A wolf eating a bone, got its bone stuck in its throat, and ran around looking for help. He found a crane in his run and asked him to save him from that situation, and he would immediately pay him for it. He accepted the crane and put his head in the wolf's mouth, pulling the bone through his throat. He then requested the cancellation of the agreed salary. "Hey, buddy", said the wolf, "don't you think it's enough pay to have your head out of my mouth safe and sound?" Do not do favors to the wicked, for you would be well paid if you were left unharmed.
title: El lobo y la grulla
author: nan Esopo
